message.content:
We rewrite the equation $x^2 - 8x + 8 = 0$ slightly by subtracting $8$ from both sides: $$x^2 - 8x = -8.$$Now comes the completing the square step. Since the coefficient of $x$ is $-8$, half the coefficient is $-4$. So we add and subtract $(-4)^2 =16$ to the left side: \begin{align*}
x^2-8x&=-8\\
( x^2-8x +16) - 16 & =-8\\
(x-4)^2-16&=-8\\
(x-4)^2 &= 8.\\
\end{align*}Thus we can take $b=-4$ and $c=8$. Therefore, $b+c=-4+8=\boxed{4}$.
